title.value: Posterior inference of Hi-C contact frequency through sampling
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper as "Posterior inference of Hi-C contact frequency through sampling."
title.quote: Zhang Y, Cameron CJF and Blanchette M (2024), Posterior inference of Hi-C contact frequency through sampling. Front. Bioinform. 3:1285828.

extractions.description: This paper introduces HiCSampler, a Markov random field model utilizing MCMC sampling, to infer the posterior distribution of Hi-C interaction frequencies. It addresses uncertainty in interaction frequencies in Hi-C contact maps and enables their use in downstream analyses.

type.justification: The paper is empirical as it involves developing and testing a new model (HiCSampler) through experiments using Hi-C data to infer posterior distributions and measure uncertainties.
type.quote: Here, we present the Hi-C interaction frequency sampler (HiCSampler) that reliably infers the posterior distribution of the interaction frequency for a given Hi-C contact map by exploiting dependencies between neighboring loci.

name.justification: The research is situated within the field of Bioinformatics, focusing on analyzing complex biological data (Hi-C contact maps) using computational methods.
The paper deals with genomic data, specifically the three-dimensional organization of genomes, which falls under Genomics.
name.quote: Hi-C is designed to measure whole-genome pairwise interaction frequencies.

name.justification: The research includes modeling biological processes and involves computational techniques, linking it to Computational Biology.
name.quote: We model the interaction frequency as a Markov random field on a second-order neighborhood system.

name.justification: HiCSampler is the primary model introduced and contributed by this paper to infer the posterior distribution of Hi-C interaction frequencies.
name.quote: Here, we introduce HiCSampler, a Markov random field (MRF) model that provides posterior inference of the Hi-C interaction frequency.

is_contributed.justification: The authors developed HiCSampler as a new model as detailed in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Here, we present the Hi-C interaction frequency sampler (HiCSampler)...

is_executed.justification: HiCSampler is executed in experiments to demonstrate its effectiveness in inferring interaction frequencies.
is_executed.quote: We applied HiCSampler to infer 10,000 posterior samples for a Hi-C contact map.

is_compared.justification: HiCSampler is compared with other models to evaluate its performance in terms of likelihood on test samples.
is_compared.quote: To further investigate the accuracy of HiCSampler, we compared HiCSampler against three other models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific prior paper is directly referenced for the HiCSampler model as it is a newly developed model in this study.

name.justification: The dataset used in the paper is the Hi-C data for the GM12878 cell line, which is explicitly mentioned in the text.
name.quote: We downloaded the processed Hi-C datasets for the GM12878 cell line generated by Rao et al. (2014).
